name: Lilongwe Wildlife Centre
description: A 70‑hectare wildlife sanctuary and rescue centre for injured or orphaned animals, managed by the Lilongwe Wildlife Trust.

name: Kamuzu Mausoleum
description: Marble and granite mausoleum of Malawi’s first president, Dr. Hastings Kamuzu Banda, with a museum, library and pillars inscribed with his guiding principles.

name: Parliament Building
description: Modern legislative complex offering guided tours and insight into Malawi’s governance, set within well-kept gardens.

name: Maula Cathedral
description: Principal Catholic cathedral in Lilongwe, known for its peaceful ambiance, distinctive architecture and vibrant communal services.

name: Lilongwe Nature Sanctuary
description: Serene urban forest reserve with hiking trails, creek-side boardwalks and abundant birdlife—a quiet escape within the city.

name: Old Town Market
description: Bustling open-air market with fresh produce, spices, clothes and crafts—ideal for experiencing everyday local life.

name: Lilongwe Golf Club
description: Scenic 18‑hole championship golf course with café, gym, pool, and peaceful grounds—open to both golfers and walkers.

name: Artisan Market
description: Vibrant craft bazaar offering handmade jewelry, textiles, woodwork and souvenirs, with occasional artisan demos.
